body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Stale ACK | [w0xlt](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25297#pullrequestreview-1003035094) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#bitcoin-core/gui/650](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/650) (Add Import to Wallet GUI by KolbyML)
* [#27601](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27601) (wallet: don't duplicate change output if already exist by furszy)
* [#27469](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27469) (wallet: improve IBD sync time by skipping block scanning prior birth time by furszy)
* [#27307](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27307) (wallet: track mempool conflicts with wallet transactions by ishaanam)
* [#27286](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27286) (wallet: Keep track of the wallet's own transaction outputs in memory by achow101)
* [#27145](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27145) (wallet: when a block is disconnected, update transactions that are no longer conflicted by ishaanam)
* [#26840](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26840) (refactor: importpubkey, importprivkey, importaddress, importmulti, and importdescriptors rpc by KolbyML)
* [#26728](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26728) (wallet: Have the wallet store the key for automatically generated descriptors by achow101)
* [#26715](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26715) (Introduce `MockableDatabase` for wallet unit tests by achow101)
* [#26627](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26627) (wallet: Migrate non-HD keys with single combo containing a list of keys by achow101)
* [#26008](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26008) (wallet: cache IsMine scriptPubKeys to improve performance of descriptor wallets by achow101)
* [#25907](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25907) (wallet: rpc to add automatically generated descriptors by achow101)
* [#25881](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25881) (wallet: remove unused DummySignTx and CKeyPool from GetReservedDestination by furszy)
* [#24914](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24914) (wallet: Load database records in a particular order by achow101)
* [#22838](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22838) (descriptors: Be able to specify change and receiving in a single descriptor string by achow101)
* [#22341](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22341) (rpc: add getxpub by Sjors)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

nit:

```suggestion
                MarkConflicted(batch, /*hashBlock=*/prev->conflicting_block_hash, /*conflicting_height=*/prev->conflicting_block_height, /*hashTx=*/wtx.GetHash());
```

nit:
```suggestion
                            SetAddressBookWithDB(batch, /*address=*/dest.dest, /*strName=*/"", /*strPurpose=*/"receive");
```

nit:
```suggestion
                        MarkConflicted(batch, /*hashBlock=*/conf->confirmed_block_hash, /*conflicting_height=*/conf->confirmed_block_height, /*hashTx=*/range.first->second);
```

nit:
```suggestion
            return AddToWallet(batch, MakeTransactionRef(tx), /*state=*/tx_state, /*update_wtx=*/nullptr, rescanning_old_block);
```

Thanks for the review w0xlt!

About the nits:
I don't think that the arguments names are needed in most of those cases, there isn't a real benefit adding them, the variables have a clear name that represent what they are (except one).

Probably better to do a `const auto& txid = range.first->second;` above the if block (the same value is accessed multiple times).

Will do it if have to retouch the area.
ðð¼, will do if have to retouch the area.

Flush on close is probably not quite the performance improvement that you think it is. While it is an improvement for BDB, with SQLite, the argument is ignored. SQLite flushes after each write operation regardless. It would be better to use transactions with `TxnBegin` and `TxnCommit` as these do actually batch the operations into single atomic writes.

Otherwise, I think this is a good idea to be reusing the batches.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ð This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>

Thanks for the feedback ðð¼ 

>  It would be better to use transactions with TxnBegin and TxnCommit as these do actually batch the operations into single atomic writes.

Almost there, been working on it :).

> Otherwise, I think this is a good idea to be reusing the batches.

Have another branch with more of them (chained to the batched operations work). I'll probably end up decoupling some of them into another PR (otherwise this will end up being pretty big).

Update:

Pushed the first step toward the implementation of db write batched operations for entire processes (single atomic writes).

Basically, is the utilization of the same db handler across all the methods, whom internally write to db, that are called during a specific process workflow (only the parent method who starts the process will construct the `WalletBatch`).

In order to provide the `WalletBatch` reference, without knowing if the underlying method/s will use it or not, implemented the capability to construct an uninitialized `WalletBatch`, who will be automatically initialized on the first write call.
If no db write method is called, the object will remain uninitialized for the entire process workflow without consuming any extra resource.

Note:
I haven't updated the PR description yet. Will do it once the work is finished (still have more to push).

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->

Have gotten some pretty interesting numbers :)

Simply compared this PR (tip 9806250) vs master (tip de3c46c9) running all the wallet functional tests on a M1 Pro:

Command:

```
./test/functional/test_runner.py test/functional/wallet* --jobs 9
```

Green --> this PR (9806250).
Red --> master (de3c46c9).

(note: all the failing test cases are due the OSX timeout issue, which this PR seems to be improving).

If someone else wants to try it, more result are very welcome :D.

Would be great to have someone, who has a big wallet, trying to sync-up the blockchain from scratch (with and without this PR) and share the results.
Will keep working on making a specific test for this meanwhile.
